Abolition of "Security Law" urged
    Pyongyang, August 28 (KCNA) -- Fighting slogans were released by the Kwangju and South Jolla Provincial Federation of Peasants Associations, the Measure Committee of Detainees' Families of the Seoul Workers Council for Democracy, the Joint Council of Hanam Organizations for Democracy and other organizations, said the South Korean newspaper Hangyore. 
 The slogans called for abolishing the "security law" which goes against the June 15 South-North Joint Declaration and blocks great national unity, removing the definition of "enemy-benefiting" organization from the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils, an independent umbrella organization of one million students, and the Kwangju and South Jolla Provincial Federation of UniversitySstudent Councils and legalizing them.    
 The slogans also called for discontinuing the suppression of the labour movement and ensuring people's vital rights.

articles.content:
DPRK girl snatches gold medal at Universiad
    Beijing, August 27 (KCNA) -- DPRK gymnast Son Un Hui placed first in an individual apparatus competition and a vault final of women's gymnastics at the 21st world Universiad held in Beijing on August 26.
 The Universiad drew more than 60 gymnasts from 41 countries and regions.    
 Meanwhile, An Kum Ae placed third in women's 52kg Judo competition, Pak Chol Su third in men's 73 kg judo competition, women table-tennis players third in the women's team event while Ri Ok Rim came third in the women's 10m platform diving and women's gymnasts third in the women's gymnastic  team event.

articles.title: Statement of DPRK CNR spokesman
articles.content:
FAO director general and his party here
    Pyongyang, August 28 (KCNA) -- Director general of the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization Jacques Diouf and his party arrived here today.
 They were greeted at the airport by Choe Su Hon, vice- minister of foreign affairs, and David Morton, resident coordinator of the United Nations here.    
 The DPRK government hosted a reception for the director general and his party this evening.
